<title level="1" pfs="Limited">[Saboteur](/NPCs.aspx?ID=959)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Saboteurs excel at infiltration, using it to perform destructive acts, whether they are the physical destruction of a valuable object or obstructing important political proceedings. Unlike those of spies, the motivations of saboteurs is not to steal information, but rather to sow chaos among their enemies.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 16

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 2">[Saboteur](/NPCs.aspx?ID=959)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 246</row>

**Perception** +8; (10 to find traps) 

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +7, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +5, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +6, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +7, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +5, [Engineering Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +8, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +5, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +6, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +9, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +6, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +9, [Underworld Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +6

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +1

**Dex** +3

**Con** +1

**Int** +2

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Snare Crafting** The saboteur can [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) [snares](/equipment/snares) and has the supplies to make up to two [caltrop snares](/Equipment.aspx?ID=332) and up to two [hampering snares](/Equipment.aspx?ID=336).

**Items**
[Crowbar](/Equipment.aspx?ID=18), [Disguise Kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=19), [Hand Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=69) (10 bolts), [Padded Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3), [Sap](/Weapons.aspx?ID=37), [Snare Kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=51), [Thieves' Tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=58)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 18 (20 vs. traps)

**Fort** +5 

**Ref** +9 (+11 vs. traps)

**Will** +8 

</row>

**HP** 27

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
sap +7 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)),
**Damage** 1d6+3 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hand crossbow +9 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+2 piercing

**[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)**   The saboteur deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="">Sabotage!</title>

Though the saboteur included here is intended to be a villain, PCs might encounter saboteurs on the side of good. These are typically rebels against tyrannical forces. Those who take great care to avoid harming civilians are chaotic good; others are chaotic neutral.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-198" />
